Intro_OM_Astarion_COM.synopsis: Ulma, the leader of Gur Tribe, talks to Astarion-companion. Gur Hunter from Act 1, if he is alive, also present.Scene Trigger - WYR_GurCamp_Intro_SceneTrigger_8c9acc78-9d97-4d0f-919e-3997c015ed7f
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Recruit - As CompanionAstarion - Origin Moments - Gur CampApproach the Gur Camp

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_33.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing, NodeContext: REK tay ee HATH-ran ROOST

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_20.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_20.text: Yes, I remember your hunter from the swamp. It didn't end well for him.
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_20.context: NodeContext: Referring to a hunter you killed.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_43.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_43.text: I - if I can help them, I will. But you have to understand that Cazador is merciless. There's every chance they're already dead.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_55.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_55.text: Yes, I remember your friend. And how he was left trudging around a swamp.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_57.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_57.text: Here I am. Now what do you want?
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_57.context: NodeContext: responding to "I'd love nothing more than to throw you onto that fire"

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_90.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing, NodeContext: REK tay ee HATH-ran ROOST

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_49.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_49.text: Frey vald isk durovna. Frey vald isk ablast.
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_49.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_32.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_32.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - the same monster hunters you met in the hag's swamp. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_7.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_7.text: Im orak ne tay. Krasin ne trah!
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_7.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_67.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_67.text: So, the impossible spawn walks among us in the blazing sun. We have been looking for you.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_30.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_30.text: And here I am. What do you want?

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_5.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_5.text: The last time you came to our camp, you stole our children. Our future.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_29.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_29.text: When I was hunting you, I was to bring you back here. To interrogate you, discover how to save our children, and then destroy you.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_81.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_81.text: But things have changed. You have changed.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_60.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_60.text: Is it true you left your master? That you broke the spell that binds you to him?

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_0.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_0.text: Then maybe you have a chance to redeem yourself.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_86.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_86.text: We have tried to save our children once already, attacking the vampire's palace at first light. Even then, it was too well defended.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_64.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_64.text: But you - you are someone he wants. Someone he thinks he can control, but with powers beyond his imagining.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_58.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_58.text: He will throw his doors open to you, lower his defences, and you will save the children you damned.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_36.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_36.text: I'll do what I can for them, I promise.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_27.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_27.text: We know you as an evil man.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_2.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_2.text: Then we would choose revenge. We would see Cazador Szarr's legacy burned to nothing, and all vampires driven from Baldur's Gate.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_4.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_4.text: All but you. Do this for us and we will leave you alone.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_73.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_73.text: You have lived a life of violence and sin. You have stolen lives, broken families, and caused immeasurable grief.  Doing this will not right those wrongs.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_71.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_71.text: But it will be a start. You may still be redeemed.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_53.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_53.text: Please, go. Time is short, but we will see you again when it is done.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_83.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_83.text: And if I decline to help?

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_42.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_42.text: Then we can all see what you really are. At best, a coward. At worst, a monster.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_78.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_78.text: You think you can guilt me into doing what you're too weak to?

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_21.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_21.text: We offer you a chance, perhaps your final chance, to heal just some of the pain you have caused.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_76.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_76.text: So, tell us - who are you? Someone worthy of redemption or the monster the world believes you to be?

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_41.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_41.text: All right, I'll do what I can.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_19.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_19.text: Forget it, I'm not sacrificing myself for your cause.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_47.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_47.text: Then we have no use for you. And you must pay for your sins.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_54.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_54.text: A monster indeed. Hunters, to me!

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_1.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_1.text: Then I shall make things simple. You stole our little ones from us - can you steal them back from your master?

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_69.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_69.text: What does it matter to you?

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_45.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_45.text: It matters because you are the last hope to rescue our little ones from Cazador Szarr.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_79.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_79.text: I have nothing to say to you or your people.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_52.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_52.text: When we sent Gandrel after you, we wanted to interrogate you. To discover how to save our children and then destroy you.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_70.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_70.text: I noticed. It didn't end well for the hunter I met in the swamp.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_75.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_75.text: You would be wise not to dredge up the past, spawn.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_15.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_15.text: I know. I remember your friend from the swamp.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_6.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_6.text: Hello again, my erstwhile quarry. I did not think to see you here of all places.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_62.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_62.text: Really? You should have tried looking harder.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_25.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_25.text: I looked for you high and low, across mountain and swamp. You were an elusive quarry indeed.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_77.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_77.text: If you want a fight, you're going to need a bigger funeral pyre.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_34.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_34.text: Choose your words carefully, spawn. I would happily see you burn for your sins.

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_50.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_50.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - a tribe of monster hunters you've had dealings with before. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_28.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_28.text: *You've clearly walked into some kind of ceremony, but it's nothing that you recognise.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_88.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_88.text: *You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters just like the one you met in the hag's swamp.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_66.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_66.text: *You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters you've had dealings with before.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_55.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing, NodeContext: REK tay ee HATH-ran ROOST

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_68.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_68.text: Welcome, friend. You've joined us as we honour our fallen dead - a sombre time.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_23.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_23.text: And you have brought a sombre guest. I did not think you would willingly return, spawn.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_78.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_78.text: Well indeed. I was rather hoping I'd never see you people again, honestly.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_63.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_63.text: My friend from the hag swamp? You join us as we honour our fallen dead - you are a bright light on a dark day.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_18.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a nervous little wave

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_34.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_34.text: Frey vald isk durovna. Frey vald isk ablast.
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_34.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_3.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_3.text: I feel we're intruding. We should leave. Quickly.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_15.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_15.text: Calm yourself - you will not be harmed. Our leader has called off the hunt. She wishes to speak to you.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_67.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_67.text: Im orak ne tay. Krasin ne trah!
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_67.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_10.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_10.text: Frey vald isk durovna. Frey vald isk ablast.
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_10.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_66.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_66.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - the same monster hunters you met in the hag's swamp. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_7.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_7.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - a tribe of monster hunters. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_47.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_47.text: Im orak ne tay. Krasin ne trah!
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_47.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_61.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_61.text: So, the impossible spawn walks among us in the blazing sun. We have been looking for you.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_60.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_60.text: What do you want with Astarion?

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_88.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_88.text: The last time your friend came to our camp, he stole our children. Our future.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_74.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_74.text: When I was hunting you, I was to bring you back here. To interrogate you, discover how to save our children, and then destroy you.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_30.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_30.text: When we sent Gandrel after you, we wanted to interrogate you. To discover how to save our children and then destroy you.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_75.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_75.text: But things have changed. You have changed.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_13.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_13.text: Is it true you left your master? That you broke the spell that binds you to him?

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_31.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_31.text: Well, I mean... kind of? It's a long story, honestly.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_28.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_28.text: Free? Not while his master still lives. But he has, perhaps, earned a second chance.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_26.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_26.text: We have tried to save our children once already, attacking Cazador Szarr's palace at first light. Even then, it was too well defended.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_64.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_64.text: But if his own spawn approached? Someone he thought he could control? He would throw his doors open and welcome you in.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_14.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_14.text: And once inside, you could do what we could not. You could save the children you damned.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_22.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_22.text: You don't know Cazador like I do - he's merciless.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_54.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_54.text: You want me to march into the lion's den and save your children, but I promise you, they're already dead.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_49.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_49.text: We'll do it. We'll save them.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_76.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_76.text: Excuse me? Did you not hear anything I just said? They're gone.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_50.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_50.text: How can you be sure, Astarion?

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_48.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_48.text: I spent two hundred years bringing him victims. Each and every one was whisked away to be fed on that night.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_35.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_35.text: But you never saw him feed yourself? He could keep prisoners for days before killing them.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_4.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_4.text: I know our plight is grim, but if there is even a chance to save them, we must take it.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_6.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_6.text: If our children are truly gone, then we ask for blood. I know you can understand that, spawn.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_20.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_20.text: If Astarion won't help you, then I will.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_27.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_27.text: Gods damn it - fine! If nothing else, at least killing Cazador will feel good.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_79.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_79.text: Thank you, from me and all my people. If you can do this, we will be in your debt.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_8.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_8.text: You have lived a life of violence and sin. You have stolen lives, broken families, and caused immeasurable grief.  Doing this will not right those wrongs.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_11.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_11.text: If you're trying to encourage me, you're failing abysmally.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_24.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_24.text: But it will be a start. You may still be redeemed.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_21.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_21.text: Please, go. Time is short, but we will see you again when it is done.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_86.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_86.text: You owe them revenge, Astarion. If nothing else, you owe them that.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_69.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_69.text: I suppose... Yes. Yes, revenge I can do.
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_69.context: NodeContext: Weighing his options, slightly reluctant to concede, but he will

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_38.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_38.text: We can't help you. There's nothing more to discuss.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_36.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_36.text: I hoped to find at least one monster that could be redeemed, but it seems not.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_71.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_71.text: So you leave us no choice. You are too dangerous to walk this world, spawn. If you cannot be redeemed, then you must be destroyed.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_46.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_46.text: It was more dumb luck than any skill on his part.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_70.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_70.text: One is just as important as the other, I find. And our luck has been poor.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_80.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_80.text: What business is it of yours?

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_42.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_42.text: For those your friend stole from us, it is a matter of life and death.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_62.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_62.text: I'm thinking of turning it into a ballad, if you're interested?

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_29.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_29.text: We are not. But perhaps we can give you a chance to do deeds just as worthy of song.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_16.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_16.text: If you want to throw him on that pyre, I fully support that.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_91.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_91.text: I promise you, the thought did cross my mind.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_72.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_72.text: We want nothing to do with you.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_0.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_0.text: I have to admit, I don't love sitting down for a chat with people who've relentlessly hunted me.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_84.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_84.text: I am offering an olive branch. Do not knock it aside so quickly.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_73.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_73.text: You can take that olive branch and shove it.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_57.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_57.text: Then we have no use for you.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_87.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_87.text: You're monsters, all of you. Hunters, to me!

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_53.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_53.text: *You've clearly walked into some kind of ceremony, but it's nothing that you recognise.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_65.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_65.text: *You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters just like the one you met in the hag's swamp.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_51.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_51.text: *You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_39.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_39.text: *She's speaking the language of the Gur people, one influenced by ancient Rashemi tongues. She's praying for the fallen of her tribe as their possessions are burned.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_9.speaker: Narrator
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_9.text: *You recognise the language of the Gur people, sprinkled with words from ancient Rashemi tongues, but you cannot follow what's being said.*

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_82.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_82.text: What are you doing? You and the spawn should be at the palace, not here!

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_19.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_19.text: You do not decide where I should be. Not now, not ever.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_32.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_32.text: And you - you've been making friends behind my back. What exactly have you signed us up to?
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the playerInternalNodeContext: Looking at the playerNodeContext: Addressed to the player. Astarion's just finding out the player has made a deal with the Gur monster hunters.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_25.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_25.text: You pledged to help us. Have you so quickly gone back on your word?
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_25.context: InternalNodeContext: Met Ulma without Astarion before. Now you meet her with Astarion as your companion.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_89.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_89.text: No, of course not. We will go to Cazador's palace.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_90.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_90.text: Thank you, now please go. We have lost enough time already.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_12.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_12.text: Astarion's refusing to help you. I thought you should know.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_81.speaker: Astarion
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_81.text: What? You're handing me over to them?

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_5.speaker: Ulma
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_5.text: If we cannot have our children back, at least we will have justice.

Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_59.speaker: Player
Intro_OM_Astarion_COM_59.text: Well, of course. To hells with you!
